definition: Zuo Si (3rd century), Jin dynasty writer and poet
left/the Left (politics)/east/unorthodox/queer/wrong/differing/opposite/variant of 佐[zuo3]
surname Zuo
to think/to consider
to turn over in one's mind (idiom); to think through from different angles/to ponder

sentences.english: He thought and thought until he came up with a good business plan.
sentences.chinese: 他左思右想，終於想出一個絕妙的生意點子。

sentences.english: Would you think twice about where your money was going?
sentences.chinese: 你會左思右想錢都用到哪去了嗎？

sentences.english: QinQiong think over and over, still cannot pass patricide enemy.
sentences.chinese: 秦瓊左思右想，始終無法放過殺父仇人。

sentences.english: You don't get upset and would not even give it a second thought.
sentences.chinese: 你不會心煩，甚至都不會對它左思右想。

sentences.english: I am your old friend Zuo Sitong from Beijing Primary School.
sentences.chinese: 我是你們的老朋友，北京小學的左思彤。

sentences.english: She lay awake all night, thinking the matter over and over again.
sentences.chinese: 她躺在牀上左思右想，一夜也沒閤眼。

definition: Lu Ji (261-303), Chinese writer and literary critic
Pan Yue (247-300), later known as 潘安[Pan1 An1], famous handsome and elegant writer from the Western Jin dynasty
Yang Xiong (53 BC-18 AD), scholar, poet and lexicographer, author of the first Chinese dialect dictionary 方言[Fang1 yan2]
Shen Yue (441-513), writer and historian during Liang of Southern dynasties 南朝梁, compiler of History of Song of the Southern dynasties 宋書|宋书
Wang Can (177-217), poet, generally regarded as the most brilliant of "the seven masters of Jian'an" 建安[Jian4 an1]
Ban Gu (32-92), Eastern Han dynasty historian, wrote the Dynastic History of Western Han 漢書|汉书
Yu Xin (513-581), poet from Liang of the Southern dynasties 南朝梁朝 and author of Lament for the South 哀江南賦|哀江南赋
Cao Zhi (192-232), son of Cao Cao 曹操, noted poet and calligrapher
Liu Yuxi (772-842), Tang poet
Wang Bo (650-676), one of the Four Great Poets of the Early Tang 初唐四傑|初唐四杰[Chu1 Tang2 Si4 jie2]
History of the Jin Dynasty, fifth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Fang Xuanling 房玄齡|房玄龄[Fang2 Xuan2 ling2] in 648 during Tang Dynasty 唐朝[Tang2 chao2], 130 scrolls
Liu Yiqing (403-444), writer of South Song Dynasty, compiler and editor of A New Account of the Tales of the World 世說新語|世说新语[Shi4 shuo1 Xin1 yu3]
Jia Yi (200-168 BC), Chinese poet and statesman of the Western Han Dynasty
Wang Chong (27-97), rationalist and critical philosopher
Luo Binwang (640-684), one of Four Great Poets of the Early Tang 初唐四傑|初唐四杰[Chu1 Tang2 Si4 jie2]
Li He (790-816), Tang poet and author of 南园十三首
